alert.note: Alert for De Witt; Logan; Macon; Piatt (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Central Illinois (Central and East Central Illinois)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 08 at 2:27AM CDT by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM CDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of central Illinois and east central Illinois, including the following counties, in central Illinois, De Witt, Logan and Macon. In east central Illinois, Piatt. * WHEN...Until 500 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 226 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen from near Mount Pulaski to Maroa. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Monticello, Forsyth, Maroa, Bement, Mount Pulaski, Warrensburg, Argenta, Oreana, De Land, Weldon, Latham, Kenney, Chestnut, White Heath, Ivesdale, Cisco, Rowell and Lodge.
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
